encoding service so you use this to process live video in the cloud AWS
media convert AWS elemental media convert is a file based counterpart for
that so this works on compressing and adding processing for on-demand video
assets AWS elemental media package is a just-in-time packaging and origination
service so this prepares your videos for delivery your live videos for delivery
to various devices AWS elemental media store is a media optimized origin
particularly for live video works for VOD as well it sits between your encoding layer and your CDN for a very
simple scalable origin that is performance tuned for the unique
characteristics of video and then finally AWS elemental media tailor is a
server-side at an ad insertion service so allows you to stitch together
programming with advertisements so that each customer gets a unique stream that
is consistently encoded and processed to a very high video quality bar

need to consistently when I asked for a manifest get back the latest one I can't

two seconds to deliver the last byte of that video fragment playback is going to
stop so we built a ws elemental media store to give very consistent

there were two ways of doing ad insertion for connected devices you
could do client-side ad insertion there the phone would make calls out to get
ads and programming or the set-top box whatever the device is this had an
advantage that you could target very specifically so each client was making calls out to an ad server and getting a
unique ad for a particular customer
so targeting was pretty powerful but the user experience often little LED left
some things to be desired sometimes you'd get back an ad that was encoded to
a different quality standard than the underlying program sometimes it would be in different resolutions or bit rates or
even aspect ratios you'd frequently get buffering as you went in to ad out of
programming or into programming coming out of ads so the user experience that
customers got with client size at insertion was not was not super great so
some customers said forget about client side targeting I'm just going to stitch
my ads in on the server side and what that allows you to do is ensure that all
the programming in the ants are encoded to a consistently high quality bar but

you gave up on a lot of the targeting capabilities that

or the output of a DBS elemental media package or something like it we're
creating a unique manifest file for each customer that contains common
programming and unique ads we call out to your add decision server and so we
work with any vast compliant ad server and it will tell us here are they the
ads to use for this customer we will transcode them to the same quality
specifications as the underlying program and stitch them into a single unique

server-side and client-side ad reporting so you're able to see who's watching
